title: Amazon fined four million euros in France over competition issues - report
text:
FILE PHOTO: The logo of Amazon is seen at the company logistics centre in Boves, France, January 19, 2019. REUTERS/Pascal Rossignol

PARIS (Reuters) - Online retail giant Amazon was fined 4 million euros by the Paris commercial court for introducing abusive clauses in its contracts with third-party vendors, French website Nextinpact reported on Tuesday.

The decision by the Paris commercial court was not immediately available.

“The court ruled on a limited number of clauses, most of which were already updated earlier this year,” Amazon said in a written comment sent to Reuters.

“As always, we remain focused on developing the best possible service for our customers and sales partners.”

The French consumer fraud watchdog at the finance ministry, which had taken the matter to court, did not return a request for comment.
description: Online retail giant Amazon was fined 4 million euros by the Paris commercial court for introducing abusive clauses in its contracts with third-party vendors, French website Nextinpact reported on Tuesday.
